summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch / Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. It demands extensive financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein and his entity 'India Wind' for the period from January 1, 2010, onward. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal laws including sex trafficking statutes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks financial records for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein and his entity 'India Wind' as part of a grand jury investigation into alleged federal criminal violations.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to Andrew Stemmer at Deutsche Bank's New York branch, indicating he is the point of contact for compliance with the document request.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signed the subpoena cover letter and the subpoena itself, authorizing the demand for records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Deutsche Bank is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce records, though personal appearance can be avoided if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, formally initiating the demand for financial records from Deutsche Bank related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005 (Deutsche Bank New York Branch)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records for Jeffrey Epstein and his entity 'India Wind' from Deutsche Bank for the period January 1, 2010, to the present (July 2019).

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws, specifically citing 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests Deutsche Bank not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The subpoena demands an extensive range of records including account statements, KYC filings, loan applications, wire transfers, correspondence, and even surveillance video related to the accounts.
